definitions.definition: A book, composition or any other document, written by hand (or manually typewritten), not mechanically reproduced.
A single, original copy of a book, article, composition etc, written by hand or even printed, submitted as original for (copy-editing and) reproductive publication.
Skip
A kilobyte (more formally KB or kB).
A kilobit (more formally kb), especially in measuring Internet connection.
Kilometre or kilometres.
definitions.example: We drove 15 ks before we realised Billy wasn't in the back seat.

definitions.definition: Thousand or thousands.
definitions.example: Just about 65 k of Jack's full salary comes from servicing the Baker account.

definitions.definition: The SI measurement value of 1,000
The name of the Latin-script letter O.
A zero (used in reading out numbers).
definitions.example: It is currently two-o-five in the afternoon (2:05 PM).

definitions.definition: A negating expression; an answer that shows disagreement or disapproval
A vote not in favor, or opposing a proposition
definitions.example: The workers voted on whether to strike, and there were thirty "yeses" and two "nos".

definitions.definition: (now only used with different, with comparatives more and less, and informally with certain other adjectives such as good and fun) Not, not at all.
definitions.example: I just want to find out whether she's coming or no. (Scotland)

Yes.
A period into which a year is divided, historically based on the phases of the moon.

definitions.definition: A period of 30 days, 31 days, or some alternation thereof.
definitions.example: We went on holiday for two months.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) A woman's period; menstrual discharge.
Used to indicate acknowledgement or acceptance.
definitions.example: I promise to give it back. – OK.

definitions.definition: Used to introduce a sentence in order to draw attention to the importance of what is being said.
definitions.example: OK, I'm thinking of a number…

definitions.definition: Used in turn-taking, serving as a request to the speaker to grant the turn to the interrupter.
definitions.example: You always do this to me! When we were at your mother’s, you said that…  – OK, OK, …
